title: Dal Soup Recipe for Babies
content:
I have shared two versions of this soup. A clear one and a thick one. For younger babies, you can feed dal clear soup. But maha doesn’t like the clear soup. So I puree the whole dal with all the ingredients added and make it thick and creamy. She loves it that way.

 

Things to remember when making soups:

1)Always wash your dal really well.

2)You can use any veggies of your choice in this soup. 

3)You can feed this soup in the evening, this makes a light before dinner meal for your baby.

4)If your baby needs some taste in their food, you can add some salt too.

 

How to sterilize baby feeding bowls: 

Start by sterilizing the bowls and spoons which you are going to feed your baby. Take the bowl and spoon in a large saucepan, cover it with water and bring them to a boil. Boil it rapidly for 5 mins. Now you can turn the heat off and leave them to stay in the hot water till use. 

 

How to Make Dal Soup:

Ingredients:

Toor Dal / Tuvaram paruppu – 2 tablespoon

Turmeric Powder / Manjal Podi – 1/4 teaspoon

Garlic – 1 fat clove peeled

Asafoetida / Hing / Kaya Podi – a pinch

Cumin Seeds / Jeerakam – 1/2 teaspoon

Water – 1 cup

Method:

Wash Toor dal really well. Now take it in a pressure cooker along with all ingredients and cook for 4 whistles.

 

Now turn off the heat and let the steam go all by itself.

Open the cooker.

Now for dal clear soup, you can strain the dal in a sieve. The strained liquid is dal clear soup. You can feed that too babies less than 6 months. Pour it in a sterilized feeding bottle and feed your baby.

For Dal soup, take the strained dal in a mixer and add some of the cooking liquid to it. Puree till smooth. Pour this into bowls and feed your baby.
